title: Travel operator TUI, airlines shares seen boosted by Thomas Cook collapse
text:
Travel operator TUI, airlines shares seen boosted by Thomas Cook collapse

Economy 30 minutes ago (Sep 23, 2019 08:05)

LONDON (Reuters) - Shares in European airlines and travel operator TUI (DE: ) are expected to rise on Monday after the collapse of Thomas Cook (L: ), which will cut some overcapacity that has hurt profits and weighed on holiday prices in recent years, traders said. Rival TUI could increase as much as 4%, two dealers said. "Thomas Cook's collapse likely brings bad news for holiday makers and UK/German governments, but takes capacity out and likely will boost shares most exposed to its markets," said one dealer.

Travel operator TUI, airlines shares seen boosted by Thomas Cook collapse
